p:
To date, seven strains of coronaviruses have been confirmed to infect humans: HCoV-229E, HCoV-OC43, SARS-CoV, HCoV-NL63, Human coronavirus HKU1, MERS-CoV, and 2019-nCoV.
1
,
3 Since HCoV-229 and HCoV-OC43 were identified in 1966 and 1967, respectively,
8
,
9 the coronaviruses have been known to cause mild-to-severe respiratory disease. In the SARS-CoV epidemic in 2002 and 2003, more than 8000 people were infected and 916 died.
10 Subsequently, by 28 February 2018, 2066 confirmed cases were attributed to MERS-CoV while more than 720 deaths were reported.
10
